thread.title: Western Digital Names Lori Sundberg Chief Human Resources Officer

author: cnbc.com
title: Western Digital Names Lori Sundberg Chief Human Resources Officer
text:
SAN JOSE, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Western Digital Corp. (NASDAQ: WDC) today announced that Lori Sundberg has joined the company as chief human resources officer, effective today. Sundberg will report to Western Digital CEO Steve Milligan and lead key global human resources initiatives and people strategies to support Western Digital’s ongoing transformation as the world’s leading data technology company. She will succeed Jackie DeMaria, who is retiring after a successful 13-year tenure with Western Digital.
This press release features multimedia. View the full release here: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20180226005441/en/
Western Digital Names Lori Sundberg Chief Human Resources Officer (Photo: Business Wire)
Sundberg brings more than 20 years of experience in developing and aligning HR strategy with business needs. She most recently served as senior vice president, Global Human Resources at Jacobs, a global provider of technical, professional and construction services with more than 50,000 employees worldwide. Earlier in her career, Sundberg advanced through a series of HR leadership roles at American Express and served as senior vice president, Human Resources and Ethics at Arizona Public Services Company, the largest electric utility in Arizona.
“Lori is a proven HR leader with a strong background for developing talent in large organizations, and we are excited to have her join our leadership team,” said Steve Milligan, chief executive officer, Western Digital. “She will focus on harnessing the strengths of our diverse, global teams to create an environment where our people and their careers can thrive.”
Sundberg holds a bachelor of science degree in Business Management from Brigham Young University. She will be based at Western Digital’s global headquarters in San Jose, California.
About Western Digital

Everywhere data lives, from advanced data centers to mobile sensors to personal devices, our industry-leading solutions deliver the possibilities of data.
